sentences.english: Oh, no. Carnations are not very elegant. Artificial flowers have no passion.
sentences.chinese: 哦，不，康乃馨不夠優雅，人造花又缺乏激情。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Safeway Flowers I, This is a close-up of a small pink carnation.
sentences.chinese: 這是一束小粉紅的康乃馨的一個特寫鏡頭。

sentences.english: It was also discussed the measurement and strategy that might be used to treat carnation rust.
sentences.chinese: 文中並討論了治理康乃馨鏽病的策略與措施。

sentences.english: Suddenly, I caught sight of the Valentine flowers which was a bouquet of roses and carnations given by my husband.
sentences.chinese: 我從眼角瞥見了那由玫瑰和康乃馨組成的情人節花束。

sentences.english: Several days later, he brought carnations again.
sentences.chinese: 幾天以後，他又帶了些康乃馨來看她。

sentences.english: But at last he will choose the carnation to company with him through his life.
sentences.chinese: 但是他會選擇一支康乃馨來共渡人生。

sentences.english: The bridegroom and best man wore white carnations in their buttonholes.
sentences.chinese: 新郎和男儐相的鈕釦孔上都插了一朵白色的康乃馨。

sentences.english: Sending a sorry looking bunch of carnations might do you more harm than good.
sentences.chinese: 送一束看起來可憐兮兮的康乃馨可是喫力不討好哇。

sentences.english: Of course. Carnation is a sign of maternal love in the West. Am I right?
sentences.chinese: 當然坷以了。康乃馨在西方是母愛的象徵，是吧？

sentences.english: Would we, as Leto did, wear a red carnation as a bow-tie?
sentences.chinese: 我們會像勒託那樣用一枝紅色康乃馨當領結嗎？

sentences.english: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole.
sentences.chinese: 他在釦眼裏插了一朵康乃馨。

sentences.english: A pink carnation blooms in his lapel.
sentences.chinese: 一朵淺紅色的康乃馨耀眼地插在他的西裝翻領上。

sentences.english: In order to express the theotokos, general with giving carnations primarily.
sentences.chinese: 爲表示對神的母親的尊敬，一般以給康乃馨爲主。

sentences.english: No problem. Would you like some artificial carnations?
sentences.chinese: 沒問題，來點兒康乃馨人造花怎麼樣？

sentences.english: He wore a red carnation in his buttonhole.
sentences.chinese: 他的扣洞上了一朵紅色康乃馨。
